newsitem.title: FRANCE: CNCA says likes Sofinco but it not for sale.
newsitem.headline: CNCA says likes Sofinco but it not for sale.

text.p: French bank Credit Agricole, which has a partnership with Suez-owned bank Sofinco, likes the partner bank but it is not up for sale and buying it is not on the agenda, Credit Agricole Chief Executive Lucien Douroux said on Thursday.
Caisse Nationale du Credit Agricole, France's largest retail bank, bought control of Banque Indosuez from Suez in July to give itself an international dimension in investment banking.
"We are not candidates for something which is not for sale," Douroux told reporters when asked if he wanted to buy Sofinco.
"It's clear it interests us if it is for sale," he added.
